item.title: Abandoned vehicle on New Acres Road, West Thamesmead, 9th February
item.description:
This vehicle has been abandoned for more than 3 months. It is untaxed since December 2025. It is causing much disruption to neighbours trying to park their cars and to neighbours who have company vehicles. Please can this be dealt with at the earliest. Thank you.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Newacres Road, Thamesmead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lots of dog poo on the grassy areas, 9th February
item.description:
We play ultimate frisbee on Hackney Downs every week, sometimes twice a week. We've noticed an increase in dog fouling which makes the pitch both disgusting and unsafe.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Downs Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Urgent repair of street light, 9th February
item.description:
Dear Sir or Madam, As the days are getting darker, it would be greatly appreciated if the street lighting in our area could be fully operational. I would like to report that the street light located outside No. 28 Wimborne Avenue BR5 2NS has not been working for the past two weeks. The lack of lighting makes the area feel intimidating at night, particularly when walking home, and raises concerns about safety. I would be grateful if this issue could be looked into and addressed as a matter of urgency. Thank you for your attention to this matter. Regards Mrs Ijeh
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 187, Amherst Drive, Poverest, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Veolia left over litter after collecting rubbish, 9th February
item.description:
Veolia left all this litter after collecting the rubbish from pavement in front of 42A Anerley Hill. Please clean after picking up the rubbish. I have cleaned up now, so no need to send anyone. But for future collections, please do not leave litter behind. I spend 2 hours every Sunday litter picking around here. It is upsetting to find this every morning. Other Veolia teams have been very good at clearing after collecting rubbish here, but it has not been consistent with all other teams. Thank you for your support with this.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 42, Anerley Hill, Crystal Palace, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sign outside 89 Comber Grove obscured by black spray paint. (Repeat occurrence), 9th February
item.description:
This is a repeat occurrence of incidents logged in June 2025 (7711683) and 29 Sept 2025 (8227575), with paint from the Sept incident removed last week. Note that this CPZ sign was restored to a lower position on the pole after temporary removal for filming in Dec 2023, so it could be raised to be out of reach of vandals, matching height of other signs in the locality.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 283, Comber Grove, Camberwell, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unsightly hazard furniture., 9th February
item.description:
This furniture has been left on the foot path for approximately 2 weeks and apart from being an eye sore it is a hazard to pedestrians. This foot path is constantly used by parents and children of the local schools.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Manordene Road, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
